Open Call · Academic + Clinical + Industry

Join the RAM‑10000 Collaboration

We are building a human‑centric, multi‑institution effort to advance medical imaging AI. Partners can contribute data, methods, compute, or clinical expertise to accelerate trustworthy models and real‑world impact. Co‑authorship and joint funding proposals are welcomed.

Introduction Video

If YouTube is blocked, open on YouTube.

About the Collaboration

RAM‑10000 is an open, multi‑institution effort to advance clinically useful AI for rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and related medical imaging tasks (segmentation, detection, report generation, VQA) across radiographs, CT, MRI, and ultrasound.

Our near‑term goal is a curated, standardized corpus of 10k+ cases to enable robust cross‑center evaluation while respecting patient privacy and institutional policies.

We welcome de‑identified clinical data contributions; see the RA Database for scope, governance, and attribution details.

You’ll gain

  • Shared authorship on papers, benchmarks, and releases.
  • Reproducible codebases and MLOps templates for rapid experimentation.
  • Access to baselines, evaluation servers, and cross‑site validation.

You’ll commit

  • Share de‑identified clinical data to help build the multi‑region, multi‑center RA database (federated participation available).
  • Open and responsible research practices.
  • Follow collaboration agreement, DUA/IRB, and attribution policies.

Authorship & Attribution

Collaborators retain authorship on resulting peer‑reviewed publications. Leads: first & second on primary articles; core team by contribution; remaining collaborators listed alphabetically by surname.

Baselines & pipelines

RA Multi‑Region, Multi‑Center Database

Why this database?

  • RA currently lacks large, openly accessible datasets spanning diverse centers and devices.
  • There is no widely adopted, unified evaluation platform—fragmented metrics hinder fair comparison and progress.
  • A curated, multi‑center resource will accelerate method development, external validation, and clinical translation.

Focus Areas

Rheumatoid Arthritis Imaging

JSW/JSN quantification, bone erosion scoring, and prognosis from multi‑site hand/wrist radiographs and MRI.

Multimodal & VLMs

Vision‑language models for image–report learning, retrieval‑augmented VQA, and report generation.

Fairness & Robustness

Cross‑center generalization, bias checks, uncertainty quantification, and external validation protocols.

Evaluation & Benchmarks

Transparent leaderboards with clinically meaningful metrics and human‑in‑the‑loop audits.

Open Tooling

De‑ID, DICOM tooling, labeling UIs, and privacy‑preserving analytics (federated / DP options).

Education

Seminars, shared reading groups, and student exchanges across institutions.

Selected Publications

  • RAM-W600: A Multi-Task Wrist Dataset and Benchmark for Rheumatoid Arthritis
    S. Yang, H. Wang, Y. Fu, Y. Tian, T. Kamishima, M. Ikebe, Y. Ou, M. Okutomi. NeurIPS 2025.
  • Layer Separation: Adjustable Joint Space Width Images Synthesis in Conventional Radiography
    H. Wang, Y. Ou, P. Ambalathankandy, G. Ota, P. Dai, M. Ikebe, K. Suzuki, T. Kamishima. ACM Multimedia 2025.
  • BLS-GAN: A Deep Layer Separation Framework for Eliminating Bone Overlap in Conventional Radiographs
    H. Wang, Y. Ou, P. Ambalathankandy, G. Ota, P. Dai, M. Ikebe, K. Suzuki, T. Kamishima. AAAI 2025.
  • A Sub-Pixel Accurate Quantification of Joint Space Narrowing Progression in Rheumatoid Arthritis
    Y. Ou, P. Ambalathankandy, R. Furuya, S. Kawada, T. Zeng, Y. An, T. Kamishima, K. Tamura, M. Ikebe. IEEE JBHI.

How to Join

  1. Email us with your collaboration interests.
  2. We’ll schedule a short video call to introduce the project, align on scope, and answer questions.
  3. Kick off with a small pilot and iterate based on results.
